headline: Easy Chicken Gyro
description: Try this easy chicken gyro recipe featuring warm pita sandwiches filled with marinated, broiled chicken, fresh vegetables, and a creamy tzatziki sauce.
name: Easy Chicken Gyro
recipeIngredient: 1 medium cucumber, peeled and coarsely chopped
salt and ground black pepper to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1.25 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into strips

recipeInstructions.text: Make the tzatziki: Combine yogurt, cucumber, garlic, oil, dill, vinegar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a blender. Blend until smooth, then cover and refrigerate until needed.

Make the chicken: Whisk garlic, lemon juice, oil, oregano, vinegar, salt, and pepper together in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Add chicken and toss until evenly coated. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil.
Remove chicken from the marinade and place onto the prepared baking sheet.
Broil in the preheated oven until lightly browned and no longer pink in the center, 2 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer cooked chicken to a plate and let rest for 5 minutes.
While the chicken is resting, make the gyros: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook each pita in the hot skillet until warm and soft, about 1 minute per side.
Top warm pitas with chicken strips, tzatziki, lettuce, tomato, and onion.

review.reviewBody: Simple taste perfect fast and easy
My wife left me
It tasted a little bland to me, but everyone enjoyed it.
Excellent! Thank you for sharing this recipe! My whole family loved these gyros!
I made with my own tzakiki sauce because my husband is lebanese. I use sour cream instead of Greek yogurt just taste better to me.But all in all this recipes is great and easy

This tasted Amazing! The dish was so flavorful! I marinated the chicken for about 24 hrs., just because I didn’t have time to finish the dish until the following day. I followed every step pretty closely. I will be making it again- today! My only suggestion is to double the recipe because you will want more; much more.
Easy recipe with good flavor. Also recommend using crumbled feta with the Gyros.
Didn’t really like the chicken. Just bland. We liked the pita sauce. Gonna try a different one next time.
Very easy recipe. Very good as well my party guest loved them

Made as written except cut yogurt sauce down by 75% and that was plenty of sauce with leftovers. I will use leftover as a dressing. Marinated chicken 5 hrs. Tasted as good or better than local Mediterranean/middle eastern restaurant by my house. I cut chicken tenders into cubes and dumped marinade and chicken pieces into large frying pan and sautéed about 10 mins. Served will Naan bread from grocery store.
I love this recipe, made it for all my gal pals
horrible. The sauce was a runny mess

Excellent flavours! I found that everything was liquidy though. I would suggest seeding and salting the cucumber then letting it sit in a strainer to remove the extra water before adding to the yogurt. The yogurt mix was actually tzatziki but was very soupy. I marinated the chicken all day, removed it fromthe marinate and boiled it on a cookie sheet but had to drain the liquid when I flipped the meat half way through.

This was great! Made it as written except I made my own tzatziki sauce. Not sure how this feeds six because my two boys and I demolished it. Broiling the chicken was super easy and no clean up with tin foil. I’ll be using this recipe again.
Delicious!!
My hubby and I liked these, but my 9 yr old who loves gyros did not. I left out the cucumber, maybe that was why.
great recipe and really easy to make!
I made this using the rest of the sauce along with the marinade,the family loved it,yet the onions where a little strong.
This recipe was a huge success for my picky eaters. Thanks will be using it often.
Nice, simple recipe for a first-time gyro maker like me! It was delicious and I loved the broiled chicken...made it authentic. Thank you!
It was easy to make and very good! I’m looking forward to making it again.

This came out great! I marinated chicken tenders for six hours, and they cooked up very nicely and quickly on my Foreman grille. I followed some of Naples' tips that worked well. I used a store-bought tzatziki sauce which was very good and saved time. I heated the pita bread, wrapped in paper towels, in the microwave. Personal preference, I skipped the lettuce but did add thinly sliced English cucumber along with the tomatoes and onions. Thanks for this delicious and healthy recipe!

6-30-2019 ~In all the years I’ve been a member of Allrecipes, I’ve never come across this recipe. Poor me. Thanks to my daughter, a young mother of three hard-to-please little kids, I have now prepared and enjoyed something new for us which I know will be on our table frequently. Hubs, who is as similarly hard-to-please as those kids, will ensure that! Daughter raved about this, so I was anxious to give it a try. Oregano is a strong-flavored herb that is not generally a favorite of mine so to be on the safe side I reduced it to about 2 tsp., which turned out to be just right for us. I marinated the chicken for not one hour, but four. I’m not sure how much of a difference that made one way or another but judging by the outcome I’ll do it the same way next time. Hubs quickly grilled it outside in a cast iron skillet. I took the easy way out, I admit, and used a commercial tzatziki sauce from Costco (which Hubs has quickly become a huge fan of). I thinly sliced both the red onion and tomato, and included some thinly sliced English cucumber as well - very nice addition! Warming the pitas (also from Costco) in a pan with olive oil didn’t appeal to me, so I simply warmed them in the microwave between paper towels. This ultimately was not just easy to prepare and fun to eat, it was simply “D” good. Hubs, who is not a leftovers kind of guy, requested a repeat for tonight’s supper. High praise indeed. I will have to see what else my daughter has in her main dish treasure tr
Made this with homemade pita, very good. Used fresh dill from my Aerogarden and leaf lettuce from the garden, tasted awesome.

I grilled the chicken but otherwise followed the marinade recipe (90 min marinade time). I'm honestly impressed (I'm an experienced cook and simple works for me). I'd definitely make this again. Also, I did salt, seed, and squeeze the cucumbers (English variety) for the sauce. I mixed the garlic into the yogurt the night before to mellow it but finished the rest sauce within a few hours of chicken cooking time.
needs feta cheese and then good!
A family favourite for sure. I have made this on several occasions and it is fabulous every time. Only recommendation: cut in have the sauce recipe. I always have way too much left-over.

Okay for aa base line.... Tastes like lemon chicken with a dry yogurt sauce. The tzatziki needs some sugar or something sweet, and I'm not sure about the chicken but it's missing something. I will find something different for next time.
Can somebody tell me the yogurt amount in cup ?

This recipe is so so good! I didn’t change a thing except a little more garlic in both the sauce and marinade and some cayenne pepper in the chicken. This is a super easy and delicious meal. If you have an instant pot, also a good way to use homemade Greek yogurt. I love love this dish!
Omg this recipe is one of my new favorites! So easy, tasty, and super fresh tasting. I will be making this again and again!
Fanstastic! Best Greek Sauce recipe I've found.
Fantastic flavor! I sauteed chicken 'cause I tend to cremate in the broiler. Next time I'll heat the pitas a tad more in the microwave so they are more pliable. *Stellar* recipe!

This came out great! Next time I'm adding Feta to make it even more delicious. I would slightly alter how the tzatziki sauce is made as blending the cucumber really makes it too runny. Next time I would grate the cuke and drain before adding them into the yogurt.
Made it! Really good. Used pre-made tzatziki instead of the greek yogurt mix.

This was a fun unique meal we have never done. We also bought the frozen lamb meat in the freezer section at Sams club. The 5 kids ate only the shaved gyro meat and didn't even try the chicken. I have to agree the gyro meat was a little better but more fattening of course. We cooked the chicken on the frying pan which we thought was great. I also purchased some tzatziki sauce at Sams club. But I made this written one too. I made the HUGE mistake of not draining any of the generic brand Greek yogurt. Next time I will buy the more expensive brand yogurt because it does make a difference. It was way too soupy so I drained the finished product which helped a little. I then added some of it to the package sauce I bought and it was better. I liked the fresh cucumber taste of this recipe that the package sauce didn't have. I also would have liked some chunks of fresh cucumber in it. I will for sure make this again. The pita bread was amazing after toasting it on the frying pan.
Made it last night. The whole family loved it. The only change I made was I used thigh meat instead of breast.

Delicious!! Having just returned home from Greece in the last two weeks, we were all hungry for authentic Greek chicken gyros. I searched for a recipe and found this one to be very close to the real thing! I cut the garlic in half because the garlic flavor should not overwhelm the other flavors. Also used an oregano spice grinder which added a fresher flavor. Did not make the Tzatzeki sauce, used store bought instead. I’m looking forward to trying the sauce the next time I make this recipe, but will not be putting it into the blender, as authentic sauce is usually thicker with small cuts of cucumber in it. Don’t forget to toast your bread, and also remember to add a few french fries!! Most of the chicken gyros that we had in Santorini had french fries on them!

I prepared this dish twice. 

The first time, my daughter selected it for us to prepare together. She is twelve. She focused on the sauce, while I worked on the marinade and chicken prep. We broiled the chicken. The chicken turned out alright, but we ended up with too much sauce. 

The second time, I prepared the marinade and then grilled the chicken strips outside on a propane Weber. The chicken turned out great as evidenced by both my wife and daughter eating all of the chicken while I was out cycling. Both my wife and daughter informed me that this recipe is a keeper and they asked me to prepare it again. Nice job and thank you!
LOVED this recipe! The marinade is fabulous. I chose to only put tzatziki, homemade hummus, and tomato on my gyro. So yummy! Thanks for sharing!
Very easy and very good! Only wish the sauce wasn't so runny.

I followed the recipe mostly. All I changes was I combined sour cream and Greek yogurt about 8 oz total to make less sauce. Based on reviews I also squeezed the water out of the cucumber and mixed the sauce hand not blend as recommended. My family loved it and we are fans of Greek and Mediterranean dishes. Easy to follow recipe. Will definitely make this dish again maybe tonight.
Absolutely delicious and very easy to make

First of all, the flavor was delicious and spot on. I was very much pleased with how the chicken turned out. Unfortunately, the tzatziki sauce I made got really runny and it kinda ruined the texture of the whole dish. I skimmed some other recipes online, and some of them say you should salt your cucumbers and get them dry before adding them to the blender. If you want good tzatziki sauce, I recommend checking out these other recipes.

I had already made tzatziki sauce, so I used that. I marinated the chicken. The only change in the marinade was the red wine vinegar. I did not have any so I used balsamic vinegar. I did not fry the bread. I used pita pocket bread and stuffed the chicken and veggies in the pita pocket and put tzatziki sauce on top. It was delicious.
I love this recipe. And so did the whole family!!!! Heads up.....this is a lot of tzatziki sauce..

This dish was super easy and delicious. The only change I made was that I baked the chicken in the marinade because I don't know how to broil. The chicken was really juicy and flavorful. This will now be in our regular meal rotation.

We all loved these! I made the marinade as written and felt the oregano was a bit to much for us. The taziki sauce makes a lot, and I cut the yogurt in half. This gave it the perfect amount of flavors. Make sure you squeeze the cucumbers prior to adding the to your sauce or your sauce will end up watery. We had a lot of sauce and chicken so we made wraps for lunch the next day, delicious!!!
So delicious, we added a little bit of feta cheese, cause why not?!?

I made this for dinner last weekend, and it came out amazing!!! AWESOME recipe. Going to make it again. The family loved it.
Thank you.

We just got back from Greece so I was excited to try this recipe. I have to say I was very dissapointed. The chicken was bland and may as well not have been marinated. The tzatziki recipe was ok but not great. I had much better results with a different recipe done in my slow cooker.

I made it without any changes. I found the sauce to be too acidic, and the chicken was overpowered by too much oregano. It was also quite fussy to make in the broiler. Next time, I would marinate the chicken breast whole (with a lot less oregano), grill it, rest it, and slice it before serving it. And I would use a completely different sauce recipe with a better depth of flavor and a lot less acid.
This was something very different for me to make and I loved it! Followed the recipe, my only issue was we had a ton of sauce left over.
Way too much time for watery salad in flat bread, way over thought. Never again.
It was OK is all I can say.
Kind of bland
it was good
The marinade is the best! Love this recipe and we eat it all the time. We use warmed pitas, store bought tzaticki sliced red onion and tomato. Yum!
Only exception I made was I cut the chicken into cubes rather than strips to hurry the marinating along. My guys loved it.
Will add more garlic ne t time but very good otherwise

Came out great ! The only negative was that the sauce was very thin after blending it. I am sure that was due to basically liquifying the Cucumber and I even used Greek Yogurt. Next time I will use less Cucumber in the blender and shred the rest and mix it in.

Outstanding recipe!! I was surprised how good it was. I cut the oregano down a bit based on other reviewer's comments, but that's the only modification I did. I served the chicken on top of grilled pita bread with lettuce, black olives, chopped tomatoes, and the yogurt sauce. Thank you for this wonderful recipe. It will save me a lot of money from going to the Greek restaurant!!

I did exactly what the recipe said and I thought it was to lemony. Also 16oz of Greek yogurt was way to much and it was like a tasteless salad dressing. It should be much thicker. It wasn't so horrible that I couldn't eat it, but it is not something I will try again or recommend.
Good, easy and quick recipe. I doubled the dill that it called for.
They were ok. I made them exactly to recipe. Maybe if I had grilled the chicken as many others did it would have been better.

After reading the comments on this recipe I decided to take some creative liberties. First, for the tzatziki I used a food processor for the cucumber only. Seeded and finely minced cucumber squeezed through a tea towel to get rid of the excess moisture. Then I mixed the rest of the sauce ingredients by hand. Secondly I used fresh dill in the tzatziki. For the marinade I used chicken thighs for more of a flavor. In addition to the ingredients listed for the marinade I added about 2 tsp of dried parsley and ~1 tsp of ground thyme, ~1 tsp dried basil, and about 1 1/2 tsp of dill weed. You can even add rosemary, marjoram, nutmeg and cinnamon if you like those flavors to get a great greek seasoning. I will update my review once we taste it tonight! Currently marinating the chicken thighs and letting the tzatziki flavors marinate in the fridge too!

Here's the recipe I used to inspire my marinade: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/231228/greek-seasoning-blend/
Easy to make .. great flavor made extra sauce .. family and friends thought it was delicious!!!

I loved it! It was perfect! The chicken marinade was super! It broiled perfectly! I cooked my onions because that's how they're prepared when we buy gyros. The chicken Took more time in the broiler than the recipe stated. I used sour cream for the sauce because that's what I had on hand. 

WARNING! Do not follow these directions for making the sauce. The 1st batch of it I made tasted amazing but had the consistency of a glass of milk. My 2nd try I squeeze dried the cucumber before chopping it in my magic bullet. After blending it I blotted it on paper towels and hand mixed the sauce. This time it was awesome! I'm sharing this recipe with family and friends asap!
The whole family absolutely loved this! Thanks
This was delicious! So easy to make and healthy.

I made the chicken, not the tzatziki sauce but I regret that. Marinated the chicken, threw it in the Actifry for 15 min and served it with lettuce, red onion, tomato and store-bought tzatziki sauce. I only with the tzatziki has more garlic...will definitely try again with the sauce recipe. Served on oven-warm naan bread. Wrapped the bottom in tinfoil to keep the insides in. Delicious!

I tried liking it. The heating time/temperature/setting must be wrong because when I broiled the chicken, the chicken tasted undercooked.

The spices / oil were not flavorful AT all. I wouldn't recommend this recipe. Still looking for something better.

Love this recipe. However it seems like there isn't enough marinade for chicken and too much sauce. Next time I will double the liquid in marinade and half the sauce recipe. Other than that, this is delicious!!

1) The seasoning tasted so bland.
2) The chicken is UNDERCOOKED at 2-4 minutes in the oven broiler. Seriously? Who wrote this abominable recipe? Stupid beyond measure.
3) I barely ate it. I had to add garlic salt to even finish the meal.
Very good recipe! We "kicked up" the marinade with a little bit of curry. It gave it just enough. Definitely keeping this in the dinner rotation.

I love Greek food and was excited about trying this. My husband thought it was very good, but, I thought the oregano was a little overwhelming. All I tasted on the chicken was oregano with little other flavor. Once on the pita mixed with the other ingredients it did balance out the flavor.
This was fantastic ... The only thing I did differently was purchased the sauce die t time constraints..
I didn't leave the chicken long enough to marinate, but we still enjoyed it.
This is a favorite in our household!!!! I don't know if it's something I'm doing but the sauce is always a bit thin, but no one seems to either care or notice! Awesome!!!
grilled chicken , and used Hidden Valley Greek Tzatziki dressing also sprinkled on some crumbled feta cheese , we really enjoyed this will make again

We will be making this again and again! Easier than I would have imagined, so yummy, and fairly healthy. I didn't have a blender so I just finely chopped the cucumber and it was still great, I will try blending next time. Toasting the pita in olive oil was a huge addition!
This makes a crazy amount of the sauce. It could be cut by 75% and still have enough.
The chicken just tasted of all oregano. The sauce was awful as well. I will not make this again.
This was so delicious my entire family loved it!

We've played around with a few different recipes and this one is by far the easiest and tastiest! I like broiling the chicken as I'm super picky about meat being cooked all the way. I love the sauce, although there's always WAY too much of it. And thank goodness for my little bullet-style blender to make the sauce faster :)
I thought the flavor of the chicken was delicious. I started it on the grill then I put it in the oven, and poured the marinade over it to keep it moist. I will definitely make this again.
It was amazing! Super easy to make! We put our extra sauce in some white rice and turned out great!
Yum!! Made all organic down to the pita! Unbelievably good!! :)
I did add some cayenne pepper to make it slightly spicy it turned out wonderful
I made the original recipe and it was fantastic. I have made an Asian twist and substituted the spices with lemongrass, chilli,lime and fish sauce.also added grated cucumber.

Really good and really easy! Used thighs (what I had) and cooked on the stove, and used a food processor for the tzatziki because I didn't want it completely puréed. This will definitely be a regular in the rotation. Will probably halve the tzatziki recipe next time as it makes way more than needed for the meal. Thanks!!
This recipe was pretty good. We grilled the chicken instead of broiling and put the chicken in the merinade over night. There was way more tzatziki than needed. I would half the recipe next time.
Excellent, easy to make recipe. Served with Tzatziki sauce I. My family loves ethnic foods and this is a great summer dinner.

This was very good. The chicken was very good and not dry. I thought the sauce was lacking so I added some feta. The sauce was also thinner than I would have preferred and I have a ton of sauce leftover. I must have made a mistake but I've rechecked the recipe and believe I used the amount called for of yogurt. I'm curious if this is the same experience others had.

My family loved it! The only thing I did differently was cooked it I'm a pan in a little bit of canola oil- I never trust myself with the broiler! I'm not sure if I diddid something wrong but my sauce was really thin, I did halve it and even so it made a TON of sauce. I am going to use the left over sauce and chicken to make a Greek salad with feta cheese tomatoes and cucumbers. Love a meal I can turn into 2!

This is my go to recipe for chicken gyros. The marinade for the chicken is so delicious! The sauce was good, but I do like the kind I can get at my local restaurant a bit better. Too much dill for my taste, but overall it is a great recipe.
5 stars for the tzatiki, 4 stars for the chicken. Pretty tasty!
So good! This is great summer food! But I love it...so I will be making it often. Thx Karen
Awesome! My son likes to eat the chicken alone.
